title: Colombia's most wanted drug lord captured
content: The US had placed a $5m bounty on the head of Dairo Antonio Úsuga, better known as Otoniel.

title: Injured filmmaker 'gutted' at movie set death
content: Joel Souza, wounded by a gun fired by actor Alec Baldwin, grieves for lost friend Halyna Hutchins.

title: Turkey moves to throw out US envoy and nine others
content: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan declares them "persona non grata" for urging an activist's release.

title: Picasso works fetch nearly $110m in Las Vegas sale
content: The works, which were owned by MGM Resorts, featured in the Picasso Restaurant at the Bellagio.

title: Greta on Greta: I'm a different person in private
content: The activist says she's unrecognisable when she isn't campaigning for climate action.

title: UK textbook pulled over Native American question
content: An exam board apologises and says the textbook should never have been approved.

title: Record-breaking ferris wheel opens in Dubai
content: The massive wheel was opened in Dubai with a lavish fireworks display to mark the occasion.

title: Italy's Salvini on trial for blocking migrant boat
content: The right-wing politician is charged with kidnapping and dereliction of duty, which he denies.

title: Police probe banner opposing Saudi Newcastle takeover
content: The banner was held by Crystal Palace fans at their Premier League match on Saturday.

title: China passes law to lift homework pressure
content: A new law urges parents to allow children time for rest and exercise, and restrict time spent online.

title: Greta: We need public pressure, not just summits
content: The climate activist speaks to the BBC about the COP26 conference, emissions targets and rickrolling.

title: Saudi Arabia commits to net zero emissions by 2060
content: The world's biggest oil exporter will cut carbon emissions, but not stop producing fossil fuels.

title: England crush West Indies in T20 opener
content: England bowl West Indies out for 55 as they make a stunning start to their Men's T20 World Cup campaign with a six-wicket win in Dubai.

title: Ecuador sprinter Alex Quiñónez shot dead
content: Quiñónez, one of the country's best known athletes, was shot in the city of Guayaquil.
